pros: Was able to grow and learn a lot in the different offices I worked in. Very communicative and wanted me to grow and succeed.
cons: Obviously, as a student worker, you don't get paid much, but the experience that you gain is great and looks great to employers.

pros: Good environment and great faculty, staff, and students.
cons: It was all a great experience, just not good parking.

pros: Good flexibility with a great supervisor
cons: Compensation is minimal with no room for growth.

pros: On campus clinic Full-time employee dependents tuition paid Full-Time employee tuition paid Plenty of vacation, personal, and sick time Many paid holidays and school breaks such as spring break and Christmas break
cons: Salary on the low end of Texas average

pros: Great communication and guidance into first career
cons: This was a great experience, no cons

pros: ETBU is family oriented. I was hired right before graduating with my bachelors due to my reputation with the university as a student. The job is extremely laid back. In the mornings, we normally have a couple hours of down time. Our main job is to recruit students by making phone calls, giving presentations, visiting with students and going to school fairs. No two days in the office are the same. We have random task that we do, which make things more interesting. It is rewarding seeing the students you recruit come in the fall. In the fall months we do travel a good bit. Overall, I love the community in the office, and the fun we have on a day to day basis. Vacation time and benefits are awesome.
cons: If you are not a people person, this job will be very exhausting. We have a goal of calls that we try to make daily, and at times it can be mundane and draining.

review_title: Depends on who you work for
pros: Dr. Blackburn is great. Works hard and has high expectations which can make some days stressful but he truly wants what's best for the University.
cons: Some Vice Presidents have driven away tons of employees in their time there. It's no coincidence that numerous high quality faculty are leaving every year.
yearly raises barely cover cost of living and insurance rate increases, insurance expensive

pros: Faith-based community and co-workers that care about you.

cons: Duty nights are inconsistent with Covid
Expects you to work even when you are not getting paid

review_title: The faculty and staff from every department are wonderful to work with.
pros: The very best reason to work for ETBU is the people you work with. It is family oriented. You become close to the faculty and staff. Cabinet members intentionally fellowship with employees from all department levels. Students are wonderful and eager to learn. Everyone is helpful and friendly. Great small college atmosphere. The campus is beautiful. Great place to work.
cons: Micromanagement is a common management practice within some of the departments. Raises are determined by a performance-based system.

job_title: Records Student Worker in Marshall, TX
pros: Flexible, Consistent Hours, Works around class schedule
cons: more formal, high expectations, a lot of responsibility
Bad pay, rules are very strict
